intro: Rigiostachys, commonly known as the golden spike grass, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Poaceae. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typical of the grass family. Rigiostachys species are often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
